sentences.sContent: Their servile lives were spent in grovelling and cringing and toiling and running about like little dogs at the behest of their numerous masters.
sentences.sContent_eng: Their servile lives were spent in grovelling and cringing and toiling and running about like little dogs at the behest of their numerous masters.
sentences.sCn: 他们卑躬屈节的一生是在拍马奉承、拼命干活中度过的，他们象小狗般的奔走在无数主人膝下。

sentences.sContent: She even disgraces the name of Linton; and I've sometimes relented, from pure lack of invention, in my experiments on what she could endure, and still creep shamefully cringing back!
sentences.sContent_eng: She even disgraces the name of Linton; and I've sometimes relented, from pure lack of invention, in my experiments on what she could endure, and still creep shamefully cringing back!
sentences.sCn: 她甚至都玷辱了林惇的名声，我试验她能忍受的能力，而她总还是含羞地谄媚地爬回来，由于实在想不出新的办法，我有时候都动了慈悲心肠哩！

remMethod.val: cring(= cringe 畏缩) + ing → 一直向后退缩 → 谄媚的
